code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers
Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:a F shoemaker aged 25 yrs reports critical cough, Respiratory. Also complains of critical shortness of breath from time to time. o:Height 66 in, Weight 152 lbs, Temperature 98.3 F, Pulse 84, SystolicBP 106, DiastolicBP 63, Respiration 13, Arterial Blood Gas 7.4,PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=60 mmHg, Chest X-Ray shows hyperinflated lung, SaO2 89% RA; 93% on 4L NC, Alert, Mod distress in pt ""tripod-ding"" for breath, PCO2 elevated on ABG, PEF: 25% expected, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Asthma p:administered IPRATROPIUM - 0.02 % SOLN neb over 20 min, performed Arterial Blood Gas, Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.

td.content: s:patient c/o 3 weeks h/o critical cough (not checked), critical shortness of breath. NKDA. she is a F shoemaker aged 26 Ys. o:Height 67 in, Weight 157 lbs, Temperature 98.7 F, Pulse 81, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 16, Arterial Blood Gas 7.4,PaCO2=44 mmHg,PaO2=60 mmHg, Chest X-Ray shows hyperinflated lung, SaO2 89% RA; 93% on 4L NC, Alert, Mod distress in pt ""tripod-ding"" for breath, PCO2 elevated on ABG, PEF: 25% expected, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs a:Asthma p:administered Nebulized albuterol - 10 mg neb over 1hr, performed Arterial Blood Gas, Chest X-Ray, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed.
